As I’m in the home stretch of coding school, I’ve started to reflect on what motivates me to learn this stuff. There’s a few reasons I’m learning software development.

The power of being highly skilled at something

I’ve always been a tinkerer. I learned HTML and CSS in high school. I was the kid that installed games on my TI-83. I used to make custom themes for iPods by modifying the firmware with iPodWizard. Tinkering with things provides me immense intellectual satisfaction, but I want to do more than just tinker.

I’m learning to code because this is a specialized set of skills, which holds more power (and therefore more fun!). It’s got all the same joy of tinkering with code, but I’ve got a more deep understanding of what is being built by those lines of code.

Technology has changed our world so vastly in the past decade. That rate is only increasing. To be as close to the forefront of technology is a skill and privledge.

QUOTE FROM PROGRAM OR BE PROGRAMMED

Open Source Software
